extendedIngredients.name: chicken breasts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2-3 chicken breasts, cut in half lengthwise and cubed

extendedIngredients.name: cooked pasta
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (8-ounce) package pasta, your favorite style, cooked

recipes.title: Chicken Pasta with Roasted Red Pepper Cream Sauce

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken can be paired with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 27 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Selected from three of California's most recognized Chardonnay appellations, Sonoma, Monterey and Napa, our Ghost Pines Chardonnay offers expressive, fruit-forward characteristics. The artful combination of these three regions delivers baked apple, pear and lemon cream flavors, accented by an elegant finish of sweet vanilla.

recipes.instructions: Melt butter in a 12-inch skillet over medium heat. Add in chicken and cook until cooked throughout and browned, about 8 minutes. Remove chicken to a bowl and set aside.Prepare roasted red pepper cream sauce in the skillet. Drain cooked pasta and toss in the cream sauce with tongs, making sure to coat pasta as much as possible. Add back in chicken. Add fresh spinach and remove from heat. Toss all ingredients together and add salt and pepper, to taste.Serve warm.

steps.step: Melt butter in a 12-inch skillet over medium heat.
Add in chicken and cook until cooked throughout and browned, about 8 minutes.
Remove chicken to a bowl and set aside.Prepare roasted red pepper cream sauce in the skillet.
Drain cooked pasta and toss in the cream sauce with tongs, making sure to coat pasta as much as possible.
Add fresh spinach and remove from heat. Toss all ingredients together and add salt and pepper, to taste.
